content.raw:
I may be going crazy, but I don't think ODE properly obeys universal joint limits. The `universal_joint_test.world` has a upper and lower limit of 1.4 radians on the first axis of `joint00`. In the integration test `joint_universal`, the link is moved such that the joint angle is 1.5707 radians. 

ODE happily reports the angle is 1.5707 radians. ODE will also allow you to control the joint well past it's set limits.

Bullet now behaves as I would expect. The joint constraint return 1.49 instead of 1.5707 (not perfect but closer to the 1.4 limit). Joint control also stops at 1.4.

This is just food for thought.
content.html:
I may be going crazy, but I don't think ODE properly obeys universal joint limits. The universal_joint_test.world has a upper and lower limit of 1.4 radians on the first axis of joint00. In the integration test joint_universal, the link is moved such that the joint angle is 1.5707 radians.

ODE happily reports the angle is 1.5707 radians. ODE will also allow you to control the joint well past it's set limits.

Bullet now behaves as I would expect. The joint constraint return 1.49 instead of 1.5707 (not perfect but closer to the 1.4 limit). Joint control also stops at 1.4.

This is just food for thought.

content.raw:
ODE skips joint limits if they are larger then +/-π, see [this bit of code](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/6d9cc8763baf1697f4f93b27311fb722997ec10e/deps/opende/src/joints/universal.cpp?at=default#cl-270).

I am going to repeat the same [patch in hinge joint](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/6d9cc8763baf1697f4f93b27311fb722997ec10e/deps/opende/src/joints/hinge.cpp?at=default#cl-71) to extend angles beyond +/-π.
content.html:
ODE skips joint limits if they are larger then +/-π, see this bit of code.

I am going to repeat the same patch in hinge joint to extend angles beyond +/-π.

content.raw:
Universal joint in ODE is behaving correctly again after cc57302: bug fix, axis were flipped in `GetAngleImpl`.  This bug caused joint angles to be misread, causing bad interaction with the way implicit joint damping was implemented.  Filed issue #1107 for future improvements.

Additional improvement 7eaf3d9: extend universal joint angles reported / limits beyond +/-π
content.html:
Universal joint in ODE is behaving correctly again after cc57302: bug fix, axis were flipped in GetAngleImpl. This bug caused joint angles to be misread, causing bad interaction with the way implicit joint damping was implemented. Filed issue #1107 for future improvements.

Additional improvement 7eaf3d9: extend universal joint angles reported / limits beyond +/-π

content.raw: Given Bullet universal joint works only within joint limits of (-π, +π), maybe we should explicitly truncate joint limits to strictly less than +/-π/2, and warn user when trying to set joint limits outside of the working range?
content.html: Given Bullet universal joint works only within joint limits of (-π, +π), maybe we should explicitly truncate joint limits to strictly less than +/-π/2, and warn user when trying to set joint limits outside of the working range?

content.raw: That's a good idea, and I would even give a bit of a buffer `pi/2.1` or `pi/2.2` to stay away from `pi/2`.
content.html: That's a good idea, and I would even give a bit of a buffer pi/2.1 or pi/2.2 to stay away from pi/2.

content.raw: With the new release of sdformat 2.0 this is not checking for the version of SDF protocol anymore but using the package versions, which at any point is going to fail. @scpeters @nkoenig should we patch sdformat so all these variables could work as before or ask the people to use SDF_PROTOCOL_VERSION to do the checks?
content.html: With the new release of sdformat 2.0 this is not checking for the version of SDF protocol anymore but using the package versions, which at any point is going to fail. @scpeters @nkoenig should we patch sdformat so all these variables could work as before or ask the people to use SDF_PROTOCOL_VERSION to do the checks?

content.raw: This check was for backwards compatibility when both sdf 1.4 and 1.5 were allowed. Since we now require sdf 2.0 in the cmake search for stuff, we can just remove the check.
content.html: This check was for backwards compatibility when both sdf 1.4 and 1.5 were allowed. Since we now require sdf 2.0 in the cmake search for stuff, we can just remove the check.

content.raw: I removed the checks in 5651b10. Thanks for catching this.
content.html: I removed the checks in 5651b10. Thanks for catching this.

content.raw:
good point, `SDF_VERSION` is kept for backwards compatibility, but not `SDF_MAJOR_VERSION`, `SDF_MINOR_VERSION` and `SDF_PATCH_VERSION` since [sdformat pull request 51](sdf_protocol_version).
The files in gazebo that are affected appears to be: `test/integration/joint_test.hh` and `test/regression/494_joint_axis_frame.cc`.  But people downstream who uses these version checks will be broken.
content.html: good point, SDF_VERSION is kept for backwards compatibility, but not SDF_MAJOR_VERSION, SDF_MINOR_VERSION and SDF_PATCH_VERSION since sdformat pull request 51. The files in gazebo that are affected appears to be: test/integration/joint_test.hh and test/regression/494_joint_axis_frame.cc. But people downstream who uses these version checks will be broken.

content.raw: The point is that before 2.0.0 we don't know who downstream projects are using it, if for the protocol (most probably) or for the package (can not find a valid use case, but definitely possible). We could patch sdformat and write some migration notes about stop using this and remove the variables in sdformat3.
content.html: The point is that before 2.0.0 we don't know who downstream projects are using it, if for the protocol (most probably) or for the package (can not find a valid use case, but definitely possible). We could patch sdformat and write some migration notes about stop using this and remove the variables in sdformat3.

content.raw: That's a good point. I removed the old check in `test/regression/494_joint_axis_frame.cc` as well in 2b3c503. The issue about the change of meaning in the variables remains though.
content.html: That's a good point. I removed the old check in test/regression/494_joint_axis_frame.cc as well in 2b3c503. The issue about the change of meaning in the variables remains though.
